summary: This document is an email or memo from August 14, 2019, explaining the count sheet procedures for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details that officers from unit 'ZA' must assist with the count in unit 'ZB', and clarifies that count sheets starting with 'Z' indicate the SHU, with 'ZB' being the 'super max' portion. The document header indicates it is from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office.

events.title: Memo on MCC Special Housing Unit Count Procedures
events.description: A document is sent explaining the count sheet procedures for the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, specifically detailing the cooperation between units 'ZA' and 'ZB' for inmate counts.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
locations.context: The federal jail in New York where Jeffrey Epstein was held; the document discusses procedures for its Special Housing Unit.

locations.name: U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General New York Field Office
locations.context: The sender's office location at One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004.

locations.name: New York, NY
locations.context: Location of the MCC and the OIG New York Field Office.

keyFacts: The document details count procedures for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
Unit 'ZB' is described as the 'super max' portion of the SHU and requires assistance from unit 'ZA' for inmate counts due to having only one officer assigned.
Count sheets starting with the letter 'Z' indicate the Special Housing Unit.
The document originates from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, New York Field Office, dated August 14, 2019, which is shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
